alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 12:46PM EST until December 20 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over low-lying areas adjacent the Sebec river. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 PM EST, River gauges and emergency manager reports indicate elevated flows along the Sebec River at Sebec and Milo. The river will be near minor flood stage at Sebec for the next several hours. This will cause minor flooding in Sebec and Milo. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milo and Sebec. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
